intro: Helipterum canescens var. tricolor, commonly known as the Three-color Everlasting, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that display three distinct colors—typically yellow, orange, and red. The plant is herbaceous, with hairy, gray-green foliage that becomes more prominent as it matures. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in coastal and inland regions of Australia. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and floral arrangements.
